TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IErrorTypeSymbol implements class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamedTypeSymbol, class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.INamespaceOrTypeSymbol, class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol, class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol, class System.IEquatable`1<class Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ISymbol>
Public Interface IErrorTypeSymbol Implements IEquatable(Of ISymbol), INamedTypeSymbol
type IErrorTypeSymbol = interface interface INamedTypeSymbol interface ITypeSymbol interface INamespaceOrTypeSymbol interface ISymbol interface IEquatable<ISymbol>

Docs.summary: An IErrorTypeSymbol is used when the compiler cannot determine a symbol object to return because of an error. For example, if a field is declared "Goo x;", and the type "Goo" cannot be found, an IErrorTypeSymbol is returned when asking the field "x" what it's type is.
Docs.remarks: This interface is reserved for implementation by its associated APIs. We reserve the right to change it in the future.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CandidateReason As CandidateReason
public: property Microsoft::CodeAnalysis::CandidateReason CandidateReason { Microsoft::CodeAnalysis::CandidateReason get(); };

Docs.summary: If CandidateSymbols returns one or more symbols, returns the reason that those symbols were not chosen. Otherwise, returns None.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CandidateSymbols As ImmutableArray(Of ISymbol)

Docs.summary: When constructing this type, there may have been symbols that seemed to be what the user intended, but were unsuitable. For example, a type might have been inaccessible, or ambiguous. This property returns the possible symbols that the user might have intended. It will return no symbols if no possible symbols were found. See the CandidateReason property to understand why the symbols were unsuitable.
Docs.remarks: This only applies if this INamedTypeSymbol has TypeKind TypeKind.Error. If not, an empty ImmutableArray is returned.
